00013 /// @file taintcheck.h
00014 /// @author: Heng Yin <hyin@ece.cmu.edu>

00024 /*! \typedef taint_operand_t
00025  This structure contains taint information for an operand (memory or register).
00026  @ingroup taintcheck
00027 */ 
00028 typedef struct {
00029 #define OPERAND_REG 0
00030 #define OPERAND_MEM 1
00031 #define OPERAND_NIC 2
00032 #define OPERAND_DISK 3
00033   char type; 
00034   char size;
00035   uint8_t taint;
00036   uint32_t addr;
00037   uint8_t *records; 
00038 } taint_operand_t;
00039 
00040 
00041 extern uint64_t regs_bitmap;
00042 extern uint8_t *regs_records;
00043 extern uint64_t nic_bitmap[1024 * 32 / 64];
00044 extern uint8_t *nic_records;
00045 extern int insn_tainted;
00046 
00047 #ifdef IMPACT_ANALYSIS
00048 extern int impact_propagate;

00051 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00052 // PROTOTYPES
00053 /////////////////////////////////////////////////////////
00054 
00055 /// Obtain taint information of a memory region by its physical address
00056 ///
00057 /// @param addr physical address
00058 /// @param size size of memory region
00059 /// @param records the output buffer for storing taint records
00060 /// @retval bitmap that indicates which bytes are tainted
00061 ///
00062 /// @ingroup taintcheck
00063 uint64_t taintcheck_memory_check(uint32_t addr, int size,
00064                                  uint8_t * records);
00065 
00066 /// Obtain taint information of a register
00067 ///
00068 /// @param reg index of a full register, such as R_EAX, R_EBX
00069 /// @param offset offset within a full register, e.g., AH has offset 1
00070 /// @param size register size, e.g., the size of AX is 2
00071 /// @param records output buffer for storing taint records
00072 /// @retval bitmap that indicates which bytes are tainted
00073 ///
00074 /// @ingroup taintcheck
00075 uint64_t taintcheck_register_check(int reg, int offset, int size,
00076                                    uint8_t * records);
00077 
00078 /// Set taint information of a register
00079 ///
00080 /// @param reg index of a full register, such as R_EAX, R_EBX
00081 /// @param offset offset within a full register, e.g., AH has offset 1
00082 /// @param size register size, e.g., the size of AX is 2
00083 /// @param taint bitmap that indicates which bytes are tainted
00084 /// @param records user-specified buffer for storing taint records
00085 /// @retval always 0
00086 ///
00087 /// @ingroup taintcheck
00088 int taintcheck_taint_register(int reg, int offset, int size,
00089                               uint64_t taint, uint8_t * records);
00090 
00091 /// Set taint information of a memory region by its physical address
00092 ///
00093 /// @param addr physical address of memory region
00094 /// @param size size of memory region
00095 /// @param taint bitmap that indicates which bytes are tainted
00096 /// @param records user-specified buffer for storing taint records
00097 /// @retval always 0
00098 ///
00099 /// @ingroup taintcheck
00100 int taintcheck_taint_memory(uint32_t addr, int size, uint64_t taint, uint8_t * records);
00101 
00102 /// Set taint information of a memory region by its virtual address
00103 ///
00104 /// @param vaddr virtual address of memory region
00105 /// @param size size of memory region
00106 /// @param taint bitmap that indicates which bytes are tainted
00107 /// @param records user-specified buffer for storing taint records
00108 ///
00109 /// @ingroup taintcheck
00110 void taintcheck_taint_virtmem(uint32_t vaddr, uint32_t size, uint64_t taint, void *records);
00111 
00112 /// Obtain taint information of a memory region by its virtual address
00113 ///
00114 /// @param vaddr virtual address of memory region
00115 /// @param size size of memory region
00116 /// @param records the output buffer for storing taint records
00117 /// @retval bitmap that indicates which bytes are tainted
00118 ///
00119 /// @ingroup taintcheck
00120 uint64_t taintcheck_check_virtmem(uint32_t vaddr, uint32_t size, void *records);
00121 
00122 
00123 /// This is the default taint_propagate implementation.
00124 /// For a Temu plugin, if it does not need to handle it specially, 
00125 /// it can specify this function in its callback function definitions
00126 ///
00127 /// @param nr_src Number of source operands
00128 /// @param src_oprnds source operand array
00129 /// @param dst_oprnd destination operand
00130 /// @param mode propagation mode
00131 ///
00132 /// @ingroup taintcheck
00133 void default_taint_propagate(int nr_src,
00134                             taint_operand_t * src_oprnds,
00135                             taint_operand_t * dst_oprnd,
00136                             int mode);
00137 
00138 /// Get number of tainted bytes in the physcal memory
00139 /// @retval number of tainted bytes
00140 ///
00141 /// @ingroup taintcheck
00142 int taintcheck_get_sizeof_taintmem();

00198 void taintcheck_update_eflags(uint32_t mask) __attribute__((fastcall));

00200 #ifndef CPU_I386_H //copy from cpu.h
00201 #define CC_C    0x0001
00202 #define CC_P  0x0004
00203 #define CC_A  0x0010
00204 #define CC_Z  0x0040
00205 #define CC_S    0x0080
00206 #define CC_O    0x0800
00207 #endif
00208 
00209 static inline void taintcheck_update_all_eflags() 
00210 {
00211   taintcheck_update_eflags( CC_C|CC_P|CC_A|CC_Z|CC_S|CC_O);
00212 }

00221 #define taintcheck_flag2reg(mask, regidx, size) \
00222   taintcheck_reg_clean2(regidx, size)

00224 #endif

00226 #define REG_ID(reg, ot) \
00227  (((ot) ==0 && (reg) > 3)?  ((reg) - 4) * 4 + 1 : (reg) * 4)
